intro: Anthriscus cerefolium subsp. trichosperma, commonly known as slender cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It produces small, white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The subspecies is distinguished by its slender stems and smaller, more delicate leaves compared to the main species.
